person.name: Fahmid Shahriar Iqbal
person.intro: I am currently a PhD student in Computer Science at the University of North Texas, working under the supervision of Dr. Sagnik Ray Choudhury. My research lies in Natural Language Processing, with a primary focus on understanding and improving the generalization of NLP models across diverse dimensions. In particular, I study model behavior in terms of reasoning capabilities, robustness to distributional shifts, and interpretability. Through systematic evaluation and analysis, my work aims to move beyond surface-level accuracy toward deeper insights into how and why NLP models succeed or fail.

news.title: UNT AI Summer Research Program 2025
news.text: I served as a graduate advisor for two undergraduate researchers on a project exploring adversarial perturbations to evaluate reasoning robustness in NLP models. The work culminated in a poster presentation demonstrating how targeted input changes reveal model vulnerabilities in reasoning.
